definition: to cause a sensation/to create a stir in (a place)/commotion/controversy
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: This week, he was resoundingly upheld by the Ninth Circuit.
sentences.chinese: 这星期，他的意见轰动性的被第九巡回法院赞成了。

sentences.english: In Shanghai, Zhou Libo's stand-up show has become a top event.
sentences.chinese: 在上海，周立波的单人喜剧表演引起轰动。

sentences.english: News of the Queen's visit set the whole town astir .
sentences.chinese: 女王到访的消息轰动全城。

sentences.english: Some of the advertising market unilateral sensationalism , but it is small.
sentences.chinese: 有些楼盘的广告片面追求轰动效应，虚多实少。

sentences.english: Warriors in array the excavations opening up to the world and sensation.
sentences.chinese: 俑阵经发掘对外开放后便轰动世界。

sentences.english: This sit-com is a spin-off of a blockbuster movie.
sentences.chinese: 这部情景喜剧是一部很轰动的电影所衍生出来的节目。

sentences.english: A not-so-well-known author's first book became a smash hit .
sentences.chinese: 一位不大有名的作者，第一本书轰动一时。

sentences.english: Consider, however, the biggest animal news stories in the two countries last week.
sentences.chinese: 然而，请大家思索一下上周两国最轰动的动物新闻。

sentences.english: THERE are two ways to make a box-office smash.
sentences.chinese: 创造轰动票房记录的方法有两个。

sentences.english: His new theory has caused a sensation throughout the civilized world.
sentences.chinese: 他的新理论轰动了整个文明世界。

sentences.english: Ida was an immediate media sensation.
sentences.chinese: 伊达马上引起媒体的轰动。

sentences.english: When the first atomic bomb exploded, the whole world was shocked.
sentences.chinese: 第一颗原子弹爆炸的时候，轰动整个瀛寰。

sentences.english: The goal is exponential growth in a short period of time.
sentences.chinese: 这种策略的目的是在极短的时间内造成轰动效应。

sentences.english: The whole country was astir with the murder event.
sentences.chinese: 全国为此谋杀事件而轰动。

sentences.english: A fresh excitement in the little town.
sentences.chinese: 在那小城里又有过一番新的轰动。

sentences.english: The book which revealed certain court secrets made a noise in the world.
sentences.chinese: 那本揭露宫廷秘密的书曾轰动一时。

definition: variant of 嘩然|哗然[hua2 ran2]
in uproar/commotion/causing a storm of protest/tumultuous
lit. wind and rain sweeping through the town (idiom)/fig. a big scandal/an uproar/the talk of the town
to get round fast/to spread like wildfire
see 盡人皆知|尽人皆知[jin4 ren2 jie1 zhi1]
